body_html:
If I understand correctly, for a sample, the sum of prediction probabilities of all classes for it should be 1, right? So I cannot understand why all predictions can be zero.

I believe that prediction in document is prediction probability. And output:

\[ out_i = target_i \in TopKIncludingTies(prediction_i) \]
body_text:
If I understand correctly, for a sample, the sum of prediction probabilities of all classes for it should be 1, right? So I cannot understand why all predictions can be zero.
I believe that prediction in document is prediction probability. And output:
\[ out_i = target_i \in TopKIncludingTies(prediction_i) \]
body:
If I understand correctly, for a sample, the sum of prediction probabilities of all classes for it should be 1, right? So I cannot understand why all predictions can be zero.

I believe that `prediction` in document is prediction probability. And output:
```
\[ out_i = target_i \in TopKIncludingTies(prediction_i) \]
```
